name: Thai Calamari Recipe (Pla Muk Tod)
description: The best Thai calamari recipe for making pla muk tod at home. Easy and delicious!

recipeInstructions.text: Crush garlic and chili with a mortar and pestle.
recipeInstructions.name: Crush garlic and chili with a mortar and pestle.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the crushed garlic and chili into a bowl. Add fish sauce, white pepper, and sugar to the mix. Combine these ingredients thoroughly until the sugar dissolves and the spices are well mixed.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the crushed garlic and chili into a bowl. Add fish sauce, white pepper, and sugar to the mix. Combine these ingredients thoroughly until the sugar dissolves and the spices are well mixed.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the squid rings to the bowl containing your spice mixture. Ensure that each piece is evenly coated with the spices and seasonings.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the squid rings to the bowl containing your spice mixture. Ensure that each piece is evenly coated with the spices and seasonings.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix tempura flour into the marinated squid. Following this, gradually add ice-cold water, mixing continuously to form a smooth batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix tempura flour into the marinated squid. Following this, gradually add ice-cold water, mixing continuously to form a smooth batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oil in a large wok or deep-fryer to medium heat. Once hot, place the squid rings into the oil one at a time to prevent them from sticking together. Fry the squid in batches to avoid overcrowding, turning each piece occasionally, until golden brown and crisp.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oil in a large wok or deep-fryer to medium heat. Once hot, place the squid rings into the oil one at a time to prevent them from sticking together. Fry the squid in batches to avoid overcrowding, turning each piece occasionally, until golden brown and crisp.

recipeInstructions.text: Once they achieve a golden brown hue and a crispy texture, remove them from the oil and let excess oil drain before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Once they achieve a golden brown hue and a crispy texture, remove them from the oil and let excess oil drain before serving.

review.reviewBody: Just made this Squid dish. Tasted just like I enjoyed in Phuket. I used the rings and the tentacles. Goes perfectly with a nice cold Chang beer!

keywords: pla muk tod, thai calamari, thai fried squid
